product_description.intended_use: HMA is used for paving roads, driveways, parking lots and other surface, base, or sub-base applications.

company.name: Holcim US
company.address: 8700 West Bryn Mawr Avenue, Suite 300, Chicago, IL 60631

end_of_life.waste_disposal_recommendations: Dispose of contents/container in accordance with local, regional, national, territorial, provincial, and international regulations.

precautionary_statements: P201 - Obtain special instructions before use.
P202 - Do not handle until all safety precautions have been read and understood.
P280 - Wear protective gloves, protective clothing, and eye protection.
P308+P313 - If exposed or concerned: Get medical advice/attention.
P501 - Dispose of contents/container in accordance with local, regional, national, territorial, provincial, and international regulations.

hazards_identification.other_hazards: Exposure may aggravate pre-existing eye, skin, or respiratory conditions. Hot asphalt can release toxic Hydrogen Sulfide gas!

sulfur.classification: Skin Irrit. 2, H315; Aquatic Acute 3, H402; Aquatic Chronic 3, H412; Comb. Dust

hydrogen_sulfide.classification: Flam. Gas 1, H220; Press. Gas (Liq.), H280; Acute Tox. 2 (Inhalation:gas), H330; Eye Irrit. 2A, H319; STOT SE 3, H335; STOTSE 1, H370; Aquatic Acute 1, H400; Aquatic Chronic 1, H410

us_federal_regulations.asphalt: Listed on the United States TSCA (Toxic Substances Control Act) inventory
us_federal_regulations.sulfur: Listed on the United States TSCA (Toxic Substances Control Act) inventory
us_federal_regulations.hydrogen_sulfide: Listed on the United States TSCA (Toxic Substances Control Act) inventory

us_state_regulations.california_proposition_65: WARNING: This product can expose you to Bitumens, extracts of steam-refined and air refined, which is known to the State of California to cause cancer.

canadian_regulations.asphalt: Listed on the Canadian DSL (Domestic Substances List)
canadian_regulations.sulfur: Listed on the Canadian DSL (Domestic Substances List)
canadian_regulations.hydrogen_sulfide: Listed on the Canadian DSL (Domestic Substances List)
